intro: Tetracocyne angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tetracocyne, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Tetracocyne angustifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
